author: By John Wagner, Nick Miroff and Mike DeBonis
headline: Trump, in reversal, says he will sign order to end family separations at border
summary: For days, President Trump and his top administration officials were unwilling to unilaterally reverse the separation policy. But images of young children housed in metal cages set off an international outcry that reached the White House.

author: By Aaron Blake
headline: Trump and Kirstjen Nielsen’s embarrassing surrender on separating families
summary: Make no mistake: The administration just admitted its arguments were bogus and that it overplayed its hand.

author: By Maria Sacchetti
headline: Near the border, different buses take migrants on starkly different paths
summary: Since the White House announced in May it would prosecute 100 percent of all people caught crossing the border illegally — even if that meant separating parents from their children — advocates for immigrants say the system is overwhelmed and leading to sometimes haphazard results.

author: By Felicia Sonmez
headline: Longtime GOP strategist criticizes family separation policy, says he’s leaving the party
summary: In early-morning tweets, Steve Schmidt , a vocal critic of President Trump, urged voters to elect Democrats in the 2018 midterm elections.

author: By Erica Werner
headline: Senate rejects billions in Trump spending cuts as two Republicans vote ‘no’
summary: GOP Sens. Susan Collins and Richard Burr joined Democrats in rebuffing the package of cuts.

author: By Erica Werner
headline: Republicans, Commerce secretary square off in heated hearing over tariffs
summary: Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross defended the Trump administration’s tariffs on imported steel and aluminum amid bipartisan criticism.

author: By John Hudson and Karen DeYoung
headline: Key nuclear expert departs White House as North Korea negotiations loom
summary: The departure of Andrea Hall comes as the administration assembles a team capable of understanding and negotiating over an elaborate array of production facilities, warheads and missiles.

author: By Julie Zauzmer, Michelle Boorstein and Dana Hedgpeth
headline: Cardinal McCarrick, former D.C. archbishop, removed from ministry after sexual misconduct allegations
summary: Church officials announced that McCarrick has been credibly accused of abusing a teenager in New York decades ago — and that he had faced three earlier allegations of sexual misconduct with adults.

author: By Amy Gardner
headline: Can ‘Sam’s Club’ Republican Tim Pawlenty win in Trump’s GOP?
summary: The former Minnesota governor, known for Midwestern civility, seeks his old office in a party that has remade itself in his absence.

author: By Cindy Boren
headline: ‘We do not deserve this’: Female reporter groped during a live World Cup broadcast
summary: Julieth Gonzalez Theran, who said she only wants to talk about soccer “systems and strategy,” was doing a live shot when a stranger ran up to her and interrupted.

author: By Emily Yahr
headline: Done watching ‘The Handmaid’s Tale’ after that brutal scene? The episode’s writer responds.
summary: The acclaimed drama had already featured scenes of rape, torture and death, but the latest episode included one of the show’s most disturbing scenes ever.
